intro: Passerina quadrifaria, commonly known as the four-leafed pasqueflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the flowers are usually pink or white with five petals. Passerina quadrifaria is known for its early spring bloom, often appearing before the leaves fully develop.
